column4: I am trying to burn a DVD-Data Disc with k3b and I am receiving a error: Incorrectly encoded string (ffchen.jpg) encountered.   I there a way i can find/delete the file?  I have no idea what it is or where it is.
I've done a search and I don't come back with anything... I am confused
anyone familar with this error and k3b?
sounds like a bad filename to me ...see that squarebox thing?
maybe just rename the file
I don't know what the file is or where it is... I've done a search
HDD > DVD or DVD > DVD?
HDD>DVD
and you can't find *ffchen.jpg?
nothing
thats why i am so confused!
I have no idea what file it is or why its being added to my datacd project
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=213967
unless that last guy is you
the ffchen.jpg file is there somewhere
nope... but i saw that eariler... didn't help much of anything
I did start--> search for files *chen.jpg and get nothing when choosing the whole filesystem
sudo updatedb
then: locate *chen*.jpg
locate found it... interesting... thanks!
my guess is the search utility hasn't updated it's db for a while
if it even has one ... not sure
many thanks!
rename the file, removing the "bad" first char ... shoudl work then
